programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert travels to the Great Barrier Reef to conduct research on manta rays. The staff work together to save a baby wallaby struggling to survive

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: The wardens attend to a capsized canoe, an incident that quickly turns life-threatening. A trapped deer raises questions, and a man is arrested for cocaine possession

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and his team head to a wildlife sanctuary to treat a pack of wolves. Later, when a kitten with a deformed leg needs treatment, Dr Baier steps up

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: An Eskimo dog arrives with a broken jaw, and Dr Jeff must uncover the cause. He and Dr Nichols also have their hands full treating some uncooperative yaks

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Mariah is devastated when she learns that a friend has died. Later, a couple from Tias past are interested in adopting four dogs

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Hurricane season is approaching and Tia prepares for the worst. Villalobos employee Rico takes on a new duty when his grandparents adopt a shy dog

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Jackson Galaxy works with a mother and daughter whose cats are having a territorial spraying match. He also meets with trouble-making cat Bowie, who has been given his last chance

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy helps a single mum whose cat, Pickles, is terrifying her children. He also treats Lucifer, a cat whose food obsession may cost him his life

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson builds a treetop fortress for a couple who loves all things medieval. Features include a high tower with a round table and thrones, and a loft with a glass floor

programme.title: Bad Dog!
programme.desc: One dog loves ice-cream, while another keeps getting his head stuck in things. Plus, a parrot with a habit of rapping and swearing

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: An experiment to find out if wild wolves are smarter than domestic dogs. Plus, how polar bears keep warm and whether spiders can fly

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Fun facts about animals, asking why drowned ants do not drown, whether woodpeckers get headaches and how a 15ft octopus can escape through a three-inch hole

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Shaun battles high winds to get a lovable cat named Tigger, a repeat offender, back down to his family once again. Meanwhile, Tom comes to the rescue of Fritter

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Shaun learns the hard way that Cake is not as sweet as his name implies when he tries to reunite this skittish cat with its owners

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Keepers introduce three gaur - a large, skittish species of cattle - to the rest of the herd. A sickly Sambar fawn is rushed to the health centre

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Brett Raymer and Wayde King build a dragon-guarded, gem-filled aquarium for a family in California. Plus, the guys go on a mission to create an army tank

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: The Kilchers race through the last few days of autumn, preparing the cabins, winterising the bee hive, sorting the cellar, bottling raspberry mead and creating a new field

programme.title: Fish or Die
programme.desc: The anglers follow a lead to a remote river in Greenland, believed to hold huge Arctic char. They also investigate a myth of Atlantic salmon occupying a lone river

programme.title: Saved by the Barn
programme.desc: A cow called Buttercup comes to the barn, but the team is concerned about her feisty behaviour. Ginger the lamb battles a life-threatening infection

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: A medical emergency on the Wolfpacks ranch forces them to be more resourceful. And, Gabes family are concerned when he makes a hasty leap towards marriage.

programme.title: Tanked

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Agents recall memorable cases, including the seizure of more than 30 poodles, 200 chickens being kept in inhumane temperatures exceeding 100 degrees and a house overrun by 50 rabbits

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: When Barney, a dog with an embedded collar, is spotted in the Houston countryside Investigator Kristi Franks is called into action and a desperate chase ensues

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Steve Irwins family at Australia Zoo. Robert takes on the challenge of relocating Bosco, the zoos most aggressive crocodile. Terri helps Harley the koala find love after a tough breeding season

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Hurricane Isaac tears through New Orleans, flooding Villaloboss evacuation location and leaving Tia and the team cut off from the outside world

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Jackson Galaxy helps a veteran with PTSD whose therapy cat is making him feel worse. He also deals with a feline that is tearing up its owners furniture and their marriage

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy needs to find a way to help a distressed cats uncontrollable spraying. He also tries to persuade an owner to stop feeding her diabetic cat lasagne

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: The work of the Texas Game Wardens, who protect the Lone Star States natural resources and police its 27 million citizens

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and the team are on a time limit to treat an English bulldog who swallowed a rock. Hector gets a workout from some puppies in need

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: A friend wants a treehouse bed-and-breakfast, so Pete Nelson lets his imagination run wild with features including a waterfall that pours from the wraparound deck to the pond below

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: The expedition takes an intriguing turn when Bryce comes across a photo of a human-like hand with claws. Ronny and Mireya use new tech to help narrow the search

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Disaster strikes as Atz Lee and Jane hunt for black bears, while Atz Sr, Bonnie and Shane try to defend the head of the bay against grizzlies

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns raise the defences when they find gruesome evidence that a new predator is stalking the ranch. Plus, Gabe builds an apartment for him and Raquell

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: Russell finds a structure he believes is a Bigfoot nest. Meanwhile, new team member Ronny joins Mireya in a race to the nest to collect DNA samples

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam
programme.desc: An examination of the major advances made with the invention of the steam turbine, which is still used today to generate electricity in coal-fired and nuclear power stations. Fred also discovers how the countrys steam heritage is preserved by museums and societies throughout the country

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of Cromford in Derbyshire, which was at the heart of 18th-century industrialist Richard Arkwrights mechanised cotton mills and a textile revolution. Ben discovers Cromford became a new kind of village, built to service the enterprise of this powerful man

programme.title: Matthew Bournes Sleeping Beauty
programme.desc: After tackling The Nutcracker and Swan Lake, choreographer Matthew Bourne completes the set of Tchaikovskys ballets with a production of Sleeping Beauty, performed by his New Adventures dance company at Sadlers Wells in London. Bournes scenario turns the classic fairy tale upside down as he creates a supernatural love story across the decades, featuring vampires, fairies and decadent gothic opulence

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Rome
programme.desc: Clive spends time in the Italian capital as he goes in search of the dolce vita in the eternal cityand tries to acquire some Roman sophistication. During his stay, he meets a socialite prince and Mussolinis son and learns a lesson from a sexologist. First broadcast in 1990

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith looks at cities, examining the economic and social forces that turned the concept of the princely city into the modern metropolis with all its tensions

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith sets out on a physical and figurative journey to recapture his experience of democracy, comparing politics in Switzerland, Britain and the US and emphasising Nehrus influence in India.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam
programme.desc: An examination of the major advances made with the invention of the steam turbine, which is still used today to generate electricity in coal-fired and nuclear power stations. Fred also discovers how the countrys steam heritage is preserved by museums and societies throughout the country

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of Cromford in Derbyshire, which was at the heart of 18th-century industrialist Richard Arkwrights mechanised cotton mills and a textile revolution. Ben discovers Cromford became a new kind of village, built to service the enterprise of this powerful man

programme.title: Matthew Bournes Sleeping Beauty
programme.desc: After tackling The Nutcracker and Swan Lake, choreographer Matthew Bourne completes the set of Tchaikovskys ballets with a production of Sleeping Beauty, performed by his New Adventures dance company at Sadlers Wells in London. Bournes scenario turns the classic fairy tale upside down as he creates a supernatural love story across the decades, featuring vampires, fairies and decadent gothic opulence

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Rome
programme.desc: Clive spends time in the Italian capital as he goes in search of the dolce vita in the eternal cityand tries to acquire some Roman sophistication. During his stay, he meets a socialite prince and Mussolinis son and learns a lesson from a sexologist. First broadcast in 1990

programme.title: Earths Seasonal Secrets
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how animals all over the world rise to the challenge of surviving the winter. While some creatures face an up-hill struggle to survive, a colder climate plays to the advantage of others, who quickly set about making use of inventive means to seize the huge opportunities the season brings. Caribou become ice road travellers as the ground under-foot becomes slippery, and stoats build their own fur beds, snow monkeys set about finding warm baths, and even Emperor penguins - who are built to face extreme low temperatures - find their own way to endure the worlds most savage winter conditions. Narrated by Andrew Scott

programme.title: Treasures of the Anglo-Saxons
programme.desc: Historian Janina Ramirez investigates the development of Anglo-Saxon art. Examining the Sutton Hoo treasures the Franks Casket, the Staffordshire Hoard and the Lindisfarne Gospels, she uncovers the secret codes and symbols that reveal the pagan past and Christian future of the Anglo-Saxon people, and discusses how their artistic development was brought to an end by the Norman invasion of 1066

programme.title: Call My Bluff
programme.desc: Robert Robinson presides over another duel of words and wits as Frank Muir, Joan Bakewell and Noel Edmonds face Patrick Campbell, Judy Geeson and Edward Woodward. First broadcast in 1975

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against panellists Joyce Grenfell, Robin Ray and Bernard Levin. With guest musicians Cyril Smith and Phyllis Sellick. First broadcast 1974

programme.title: Romes Invisible City
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by Dr Michael Scott to explore the underground treasures that made Rome the powerhouse of the ancient world. Using 3D scanning technology, he uncovers the lost subterranean world of the Colosseum, as well as the aqueducts and sewers that supplied and cleansed it, and helped run civilisations first metropolis and its empire

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee is joined by Alfred J Ayer to discuss the ideas of German Gottlob Frege, as well as English philosopher Bertrand Russells pioneering work in mathematical logic

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee and John Searle examines the work of Austria-born British philosopher Ludwig Wittgenstein, who transformed peoples conception of the role of language in human thinking and whose influence spread far and wide beyond philosophy

programme.title: In My Own Words
programme.sub-title: In My Own Words: Yinka Shonibare
programme.desc: The British-Nigerian visual artist Yinka Shonibare gives a rare interview about his life and career, prompted by archive footage, photographs and home movies. Topics include the moment his sculpture, Nelsons Ship in a Bottle, was unveiled on the fourth plinth in Trafalgar Square in 2010, and his emotional homecoming trip to Nigeria - the first time he had been able to go back to see friends and family for 30 years. He also talks about the impact of the spinal virus he contracted as a teenager, which left him paralysed down one side of his body

programme.title: What Do Artists Do All Day?
programme.desc: Following Yinka Shonibare as he creates distinctive mannequin-like figures, which are anonymous, headless and dressed in African batik fabrics. The artist also talks about his life and career, with his work being influenced by his Nigerian origins and combining darkness and humour to challenge ideas about cultural identity and the post-colonial world

programme.title: Treasures of the Anglo-Saxons
programme.desc: Historian Janina Ramirez investigates the development of Anglo-Saxon art. Examining the Sutton Hoo treasures the Franks Casket, the Staffordshire Hoard and the Lindisfarne Gospels, she uncovers the secret codes and symbols that reveal the pagan past and Christian future of the Anglo-Saxon people, and discusses how their artistic development was brought to an end by the Norman invasion of 1066

programme.title: Earths Seasonal Secrets
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how animals all over the world rise to the challenge of surviving the winter. While some creatures face an up-hill struggle to survive, a colder climate plays to the advantage of others, who quickly set about making use of inventive means to seize the huge opportunities the season brings. Caribou become ice road travellers as the ground under-foot becomes slippery, and stoats build their own fur beds, snow monkeys set about finding warm baths, and even Emperor penguins - who are built to face extreme low temperatures - find their own way to endure the worlds most savage winter conditions. Narrated by Andrew Scott

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Nottingham Forest at Anfield and Newcastle United v Manchester City at St James Park. Liverpool suffered their first defeat of Arne Slots reign at home to Forest last term, with Callum Hudson-Odoi scoring the only goal of the game. Newcastle were looking for their first home win over the Citizens in the league since January 2019. Plus, Burnley v Chelsea, Bournemouth v West Ham United, Brighton and Hove Albion v Brentford, Fulham v Sunderland and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Sunday Politics Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers looks at the political developments of the week and questions policy makers on the key issues

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Jennifer Reoch discuss whether refugees have become political scapegoats, the idea of a wealth tax, and the importance of volunteering

programme.title: Prayer and Reflection
programme.sub-title: St Patricks Roman Catholic Cathedral, Armagh
programme.desc: The Most Rev Eamon Martin, Archbishop of Armagh and Primate of All Ireland, leads an evening prayer service from St Patricks Roman Catholic Cathedral, Armagh, to mark the 50th Anniversary of the canonisation of St Oliver Plunkett, who served as archbishop there in the 17th century

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles hosts from an antiques fair in Guildford, Surrey, and visits a former Victorian workhouse. Experts Raj Bisram and Stephanie Connell assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones and Kate Bottley host a singalong of school assembly hymns from Victoria Hall, Bolton. James B Partridge joins them to count down the top 20

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife inhabiting underwater kelp forests, including thousands of giant cuttlefish spawning along a restricted area of rocky reef off the south coast of Australia. Males outnumber females 11 to one, which leads to fierce competition. Larger males use brute force to drive off competition, while their smaller rivals use deception by mimicking the appearance of females. The programme also features tiger sharks hunting for green turtles in fields of seagrass and spider crabs trying to avoid predators while they shed their shells

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: As the wet season transforms Nsefu into a lush green paradise, Storms wild dog pups must learn to navigate their new, flooded world. When their mother gives birth to a second litter, disaster strikes and the dogs place in the kingdom hangs in the balance. Leopard mother Olimba clashes with her daughter, who is forced to grow up fast. The lion prides dominance intensifies, with devastating consequences for the hyena clan

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep: The Flight Before Christmas
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve at Mossy Bottom Farm, but Shauns seasonal excitement turns to dismay when a farmhouse raid to get bigger stockings inadvertently leads to Timmy heading off to a Christmas market in the back of the farmers truck. Shaun sets out to get his cousin back before he becomes someone elses present. Animated adventure, with the voices of Justin Fletcher and Marcus Brigstocke

programme.title: Dolittle
programme.desc: In Victorian era Britain, Dr John Dolittle is a Welsh vet with the ability to communicate with animals. After his wife, Lily, dies at sea, he retreats from society and only tends to animals. However, he is eventually drawn into a mission to save the Queens life. Fantasy adventure, starring Robert Downey Jr, Antonio Banderas and Michael Sheen, while Emma Thompson, Rami Malek and Tom Holland lend their voices to some of the creatures

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Joe Crowley visit the Somerset Levels. Anita joins those caring for this remarkable wetland, helping to revive habitats for returning wildlife, while Joe meets a farming family whove weathered years of flooding to see how theyre bracing for another storm season. Plus, Tom Heap investigates the food scams that are stealing farmers identities

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Lioness Rita is raising the next generation, but caring for her cubs alone leaves them vulnerable while she hunts. The hyenas strength is growing, but a flooded den spells disaster and the clan become separated. Seeking a mate, leopard Olimba begins a new chapter, but in her way is her daughter - she has now become her main rival, and only one can remain

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present from Blackpool Tower Ballroom, revealing who is in the bottom two. The professionals perform a group number before the lowest-scoring couples dance off to decide who will be next to leave. Theres also music by Lewis Capaldi, and a group of former Strictly celebrities return to the dancefloor to revisit some iconic routines

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.sub-title: Hill of Tarvit Mansion and Garden 3
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Hill of Tarvit Mansion and Garden, Fife, and visits the Wemyss School of Needlework, set up in the 19th century by a local philanthropist. Treasures discovered by the team of experts include a necklace gifted by an African king, a beautiful Lalique clock and a fragile horse and carriage, made from straw

programme.title: Prisoner 951
programme.desc: Drama based on the true story of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffes imprisonment in Iran for six years for crimes she didnt commit, leaving her separated from her daughter, who was just 22 months old at the time of her arrest. In the UK, her husband Richard fights both the British and Iranian governments to facilitate her release. Starring Narges Rashidi and Joseph Fiennes

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, featuring Arsenal v Tottenham Hotspur at Emirates Stadium and Leeds United v Aston Villa at Elland Road. The Gunners defeated their north London rivals 2-1 at home and 1-0 away last term, but Spurs had shown signs of improvement this term. Leeds and the Villans last met in the 2022/23 season, when the teams drew 0-0 here and the Midlanders prevailed 2-1 in front of their own fans

programme.title: The Eubanks: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: Former boxing star Chris Eubank and his son Chris Eubank Jr, who followed his father into the sport, are reunited after years apart to confront their fractured past. The film follows the pair as they explore their legacy, grief and the emotional cost of a life in the ring

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Hollywood stars Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson, who play a Neil Diamond tribute act in the biographical drama Song Sung Blue. Comic actor Ben Stiller discusses Stiller and Meara: Nothing Is Lost, his documentary about his comedy-duo parents Jerry Stiller and Anne Meara, while Oscar-winner DaVine Joy Randolph reflects on her afterlife romcom Eternity. Plus, American singer-songwriter Sombr performs his current single 12 to 12

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Helen Skelton host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: Scammers Used Our Street to Open Fake Accounts
programme.desc: The first of a special run of episodes for BBC Scam Safe Week. The team investigates the fake bank accounts all registered in one Cheshire street, and question if the bank responsible does enough to stop scammers opening accounts

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin has trouble figuring out the layout of a mid-terrace house in South Yorkshire and Tommy Walsh visits a property with garden problems in east London. Martel Maxwell navigates her way around a nicotine-stained terraced house in Darlington

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion hosts a special episode for Scam Week, with tips on avoiding buying fakes. Izzie Balmer and Nick Hall assist the teams at an antiques fair in Derbyshire

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Amanda Holden joins the team for a special episode for Scam Safe Week, in which she helps them go after the criminals who used her name and image to con victims out of thousands. Using the same remote access tech scammers rely on, the team will hack the hackers to monitor their operations in real time, before confronting the fraudsters, and stopping scams before they happen

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Now retired, ex-police officer Neil wants to build a successful woodworking business, So far however, the orders havent been coming in. Mentor Bruce thinks hes doing too much and needs to create a core range to have a chance at success. When her father died, Catherine decided to make her embroidery business dreams a reality, but hasnt been able to earn a living from it. Her mentor Stephanie thinks she has great potential, but is spreading herself too thin and needs to streamline her work. Presented by Dominic Chinea

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: City-dwelling families, couples and individuals set out to find their ideal rural retreats with the help of a property expert

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.sub-title: Pig Condiment Set, Thorloux Lights, Peaches and Cream Barbie
programme.desc: Traders try to make a deal on a rare doll, a pig cruet set, an Italian vintage Ferragamo coat, a 1960s travel poster, and a set of industrial-chic Thorlux lights

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Tim Medhurst begin a Scottish road trip in the Highlands, where they come across pieces of Georgian jewellery and neoclassical masonry

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When a classic car is stolen from a local showroom, it looks like a disgruntled employee has taken his revenge after being sacked. The cops soon discover that bodybuilder Aaron has been displaying aggressive behaviour and suspicions are raised that he has been taking steroids, possibly supplied by Donals secret girlfriend Sasha. Brandi thinks Clint should tell Nicole hes lost £25,000, but Clint is hoping hell get the cash back before she finds out

programme.title: If Walls Could Talk
programme.desc: The Oval Stadium, home of Glentoran FC in East Belfast, has weathered war, reconstruction and financial hardship, remaining a cherished landmark for football fans, not just from East Belfast, but from all across the globe

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Cindy goes looking for answers, Vicki continues to struggle, and Laurens hopes are raised, but all may not be as it seems

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Amanda Holden joins the team for a special episode for Scam Safe Week, in which she helps them go after the criminals who used her name and image to con victims out of thousands. Using the same remote access tech scammers rely on, the team will hack the hackers to monitor their operations in real time, before confronting the fraudsters, and stopping scams before they happen

programme.title: Prisoner 951
programme.desc: Nazanin is flown back to Tehran and locked away in solitary confinement, in a tiny cell with its bright white strobe light on 24 hours a day, and just a blanket on the floor to sleep on. She endures endless interrogations, accused over and over again of being a spy. Richard becomes increasingly frustrated by the UK governments seeming inaction, and uncovers a secret decades-old UK arms deal debt to Iran that could be the key to securing Nazanins release

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: George Best: All By Himself
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the reserved young football prodigy from Belfast who became a global superstar, but whose career was blighted by his battle with the pressures of fame. The film reveals how the player dubbed El Beatle helped Manchester United to win two league titles and the European Cup, but his extravagant lifestyle led to various problems, most notably alcoholism

programme.title: Fake Friend: The Ticket Scammer
programme.desc: The case of a Somerset high-flyer who turned his charm and connections into tools of deception, conning his friends and hundreds of others, while living a life of glamour himself. Through the voices of his victims and event industry insiders, this documentary uncovers the high personal and financial cost of chasing exclusivity, and how easily even the most cautious can be deceived

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Vicki struggles to cope after hearing that Joel is pleading not guilty, while Suki and Eve try to broker peace between Ravi and the family ahead of the adoption assessment. At the Vics quiz night, Zoe decides to play matchmaker between Freddie and Anna

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki and Eve try to silence Avani and Nugget as they join in the argument, while Vicki panics as Damon lies on the floor, but Zack arrives and springs into action to protect her. Zoe discovers someone has bombarded the Vic with bad reviews online

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Alfie continues to be suspicious of Zoe, believing she is the one behind all the attacks against her, and a badly beaten Ravi returns. Ross goes to visit Joel, determined to get him to plead guilty and spare Vicki going to court

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Alfie apologises to Zoe for doubting her, and they find an earring in the barrel store, which Zoe is convinced must belong to her tormentor. Oscar continues to pursue Jasmine, but is shocked when she steals Anthonys surgery keys

programme.title: Cyrano
programme.desc: Poet and swordsman Cyrano de Bergerac can improvise a poem while fighting a duel, but is too self-conscious to woo the love of his life. Seeking an outlet for his feelings, he helps a handsome but shy friend to win her heart through love letters. Musical romance, starring Peter Dinklage, Haley Bennett and Kelvin Harrison Jr

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Sitcom about a father and daughter reunited when the latter falls pregnant. Exhausted Gemma, living with her three-month-old daughter, sees her formerly estranged mother Davina move in. Instead of helping, her mum lives an irritatingly carefree life. Meanwhile, father Malcolm is living back at the bedsit, sleeping on an inflatable bed on the landing. Missing her dad and in a state of despair, Gemma conspires with Malcolm and Derek to hatch a plot to oust Davina. Starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The search for the UKs Next Drag Race Superstar is nearly over, and Mama Ru is testing the queens comedy chops with a challenge that has seen many a well-seasoned queen fall at the last hurdle, the comedy roast - and this one comes with an added new-age twist. Comedian, writer and actor Sophie Willan is on hand to help coach the queens and joins Ru, Michelle Visage, and Alan Carr on the judging panel as the contestants vie for a much coveted place in the final

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The Boiler Shop arts and performance space in Newcastle is the venue for the fourth heat, which sees comics Charlie Ashton, Murph, Zoe Cousin, Caira OConnor and Shugufta Choudhry battling it out to book their place in this years grand final in Bradford. Amy Gledhill hosts the proceedings and the judges for the night are Teesside local Phil Dunning, former winner Dan Tiernan and head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Christopher MacArthur-Boyd hosts the fifth heat at the Barrowland Ballroom in Glasgow, where five acts take to the stage in front of a packed house and judges Daniel Foxx, Susie McCabe and Fatiha El-Ghorri. Ayo Adenekan, Alan Jay, Kate Dolan, Calum Frost and Joe da Costa perform five minute sets in hopes of earning a place in the final at the Alhambra Theatre in Bradford

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Dane Buckley hosts the contest at Mandela Hall, Belfast, where five comics compete in the last of six knockout heats to bag their place in the grand final. Award-winning comedian and podcaster Alison Spittle and former NCA finalist William Thompson join head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri to assess the potential of contenders Eoghan Collins, Pravanya Pillay, Vinny Shiu, Lianna Holston and Jim Midge

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Things change for Zoe when she realises every time she is wolf-whistled she is taken over by a wolf and attacks the culprit. Now, on the beach on a Sunday night over a bank holiday weekend, Zoe and her friend Beth need to figure out how to dispose of a dead body

programme.title: Men of the Manosphere
programme.desc: James Blake enters the virtual world of manhood, often referred to as the manosphere, in search of status, wealth and relationships. He meets three young men who have turned to male social media influencers for guidance and instruction as they seek to better themselves and achieve success in different areas of their lives, both on and offline

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Documentary following boxer Tommy Furys return to the ring. Tommy is at his lowest point personally and professionally, living alone in a house that was meant to be his and partner Molly-Maes forever home. His role as a father to baby Bambi brings both joy and pressure as he tries to convince Molly-Mae he is a changed man. After finally getting the medical all-clear to fight again, Tommy and his trainer and father John prepare for his return to the ring against MMA fighter Darren Till. Team Fury travels to the press conference - with John promising to be on his best behaviour

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommy prepares for his first gym appearance since announcing his comeback, but with fighter Darren Till throwing threats and chaos into the mix, trainer John pulls Tommy out of the fight claiming he is unwilling to risk his sons future career. Its a crushing blow for Tommy, whos desperate for momentum and purpose. Amid the pressure, theres a flicker of hope - Tommy and partner Molly-Mae Hague are spotted together on New Years Eve, with a kiss that hints at a brighter future

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: In honour of the Womens World Cup, former England player Jill Scott is joined by Rattus for a journey through the history of football

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Rattus has an idea that might make him millions - he is going to launch a streaming service. However, to make Ratify a success, he is going to need some great songs from history

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May pay tribute to Saab, the Swedish car manufacturer that created several successful models since the late 1940s, but has now ceased production. Richard Hammond takes the passengers seat in a Skoda rally car that races a rocket-propelled flying man, and actor Matt Smith gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car. Jeremy also shreds the tyres of the noisy Maserati GranTurismo MC Stradale and the 510bhp Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG Black Series

programme.title: Fake Friend: The Ticket Scammer
programme.desc: The case of a Somerset high-flyer who turned his charm and connections into tools of deception, conning his friends and hundreds of others, while living a life of glamour himself. Through the voices of his victims and event industry insiders, this documentary uncovers the high personal and financial cost of chasing exclusivity, and how easily even the most cautious can be deceived

programme.title: Confessions of a Teenage Fraudster
programme.desc: How a 16-year-old used his job in a call centre in Glasgow to go on a five-year crime wave, defrauding innocent cardholders and laying the groundwork for a life of wealth, first-class travel and an escape from the life he was destined for

programme.title: Confessions of a Teenage Fraudster
programme.desc: Between the ages of 17 and 21, Elliot Castro managed to commit fraudulent activity amounting to a estimated £2 million. This documentary continues his story. With a trail of crime stretching across several continents as he continued to live life on the run, then 18-year-old Elliot became more paranoid than ever and a stint in foreign jail seemed just around the corner

programme.title: Confessions of a Teenage Fraudster
programme.desc: After four years travelling the world spending fraudulently accrued money, it seems inevitable that Elliot will be deported into the hands of British police, who have put together an extensive case of his crimes. Once again though, he has other ideas. In truth, the one thing Elliot desires as much as freedom is a settled life. But even when he thinks hes found it, with a new home and friends, there is no escape from his trail of lies and deception. Eventually, justice seems set to catch up with him

programme.title: Hunting the Catfish Crime Gang
programme.desc: The story of an entrepreneur whose identity was stolen and used for criminal activities online, leaving him facing messages from people accusing him of conning them out of tens of thousands of pounds. His attempt to find out more and get his online identity back takes him on an international journey and he discovers that its not only those being conned who are the victims. Many of those carrying out the con are suffering too - at the hands of gangs behind this modern-day crime

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May pay tribute to Saab, the Swedish car manufacturer that created several successful models since the late 1940s, but has now ceased production. Richard Hammond takes the passengers seat in a Skoda rally car that races a rocket-propelled flying man, and actor Matt Smith gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car. Jeremy also shreds the tyres of the noisy Maserati GranTurismo MC Stradale and the 510bhp Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG Black Series

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Two burglars break into a house, where they come across a man already tied up. Comedy short, written by and starring Stephen Buchanan and Martin Quinn

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys fight for redemption continues, but this time, its a battle for his own mind. Struggling to secure a new opponent, he knows a comeback fight is crucial for his mental health. Meanwhile, Molly-Maes new series trailer drops, pushing Tommy to face his own truths in the toughest interview of his life, where he opens up about his battle with alcohol addiction. Back in training, hope returns as a potential fight looms, leading him and his father John to a career-defining meeting

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommy is hopeful that he could be fighting again soon, and he and Molly-Mae are spending more time together. Then, disaster strikes when KSI cancels the night when Roman was due to be in the fighting, claiming illness. John is furious, but decides the boys need cheering up so tells them he is taking them on a camping trip. However, neither Tommy nor Roman share their fathers love of the outdoors

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.sub-title: Go Jet Academy: Symbiosis Shrink Down
programme.desc: While Xuli and Kyan brush up on their Vroomster skills, Tala, Lars and Foz help the Academys banana crop by removing some vines that were constricting the trees. Nearby, Glitch prepares a picnic for Ubercorn. Tala drops by to deliver some fresh bananas for the picnic and Foz spots a tiny ant on the fruit. Tala asks her Uncle to shrink her, Foz and Lars with his size-ray. The tiny Go Jetters discover the ants will accept them as one of their own if they rub the insects smell on them. Now they are no longer a threat, the team follows the ants into their tree. Ubercorn and Glitch tuck into their picnic, but an ant steals the cherry from Glitchs cake and takes it inside the tree. Unable fit inside, Glitch uses his size-ray to shrink himself and zooms after the ant. Inside the tree, the ants see Glitch as a threat and start to surround him. He makes a run for it, but they pursue him down the trunk. Glitch demands the Grimbots make him bigger again, but they miss and accidentally blast an ant with the size-ray - supersizing it!

programme.sub-title: Ill Be Seeing You - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The pretentious Semenko begins to paint Diane, but Sam despises the artist so much that he soon orders Diane to stop posing for him

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Part one of two. In the aftermath of their separation, Sam returns to his playboy ways and Diane dates her psychiatrist. Kelsey Grammer makes his first appearance as Frasier

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Part two of two. With Sam getting his life back on track after several sessions with Frasier, Diane feels it is time to come clean about her relationship with the psychiatrist. American comedy, starring Ted Danson, Shelley Long and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray tells Debra she takes up too much room in bed - but he comes to regret complaining when she banishes him to the couch. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and Debra spend a romantic weekend away, but try too hard to show each other a good time. Meanwhile, Marie spies on Robert, who has been left to babysit the children

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Seattle shrink arranges a date for Daphne with his new radio station manager - unaware he is gay. Comedy, guest starring Eric Lutes, with Kelsey Grammer and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles tries to prepare himself for the demands of fatherhood - but soon realises that carrying a 10lb bag of flour around the city streets is no substitute for a real baby. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by Humphrey Ker, Antony Szmierek, Gyles Brandreth and Carrie Hope Fletcher. With live music by Ella Eyre

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the 22nd round of the season, held at Las Vegas Strip Circuit. In 2024, Red Bulls Max Verstappen was crowned world champion here, but the McLaren duo of Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri have taken the fight to him this year. With analysis from David Coulthard

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: A shorter competition this week begins at the Tiger Inn in Merthyr Tydfil, Glamorgan, where a stay packed with outdoor pursuits and local delicacies has been laid on

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandBers are in Bath for the weeks second visit, at Hill House. Hosts Tina and Alex plunge their guests into the famous citys history. But parking problems and a big old climb to the hotels hilltop location mean it doesnt hit the heights for everyone

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Kristina and Hanne host the weeks final visit, at Romney Marsh Shepherds Huts in Kent. The rural location, breathtaking views and a trip to a vineyard have the BandBers toasting the trip but in the morning, a lack of variety in the breakfast box might hamper the hosts chances

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandBers fight it out for the prized plaque on payment day, with a packed agenda of score settling and emotional feedback

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: An alien criminal escapes from a prison on the moon and goes back in time on a mission of revenge, changing the course of history. Agent J of the top-secret Earth defence organisation follows him back to 1969, and joins forces with a younger version of his mentor Agent K to set things right. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Will Smith, Josh Brolin and Tommy Lee Jones

programme.title: Game of Wool: Britains Best Knitter
programme.desc: Tom Daley presents a round themed around children. The solo challenge pushes creativity as our knitters devise imaginative fancy dress outfits to wow the judges. Then, split into two teams, they must craft interactive wall hangings full of fun and surprise

programme.title: Summerwater
programme.desc: The picture-perfect Henderson family try to repair broken trust, despite resistance from a rebellious teen daughter, who tries to find out more about Summerwater and its secrets. Meanwhile, on the tranquil loch, Alex relives his troubles back home, and the guilt of having hurt someone who he cares about puts him in harms way

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Im a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, Squid Game: The Challenge, All Her Fault, Celebrity Race Across the World, Alan Carrs Picture Slam, Emmerdale, Knife Edge: Chasing Michelin Stars and Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly: Australia

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Rylan and his mother Linda, Jane McDonald and her friend Sue, Miquita and Andi Oliver, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Chris Packham and his stepdaughter Megan, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Fearne Cotton and Gok Wan, Martin and Roman Kemp, Chris McCausland and Donna Preston, Denise Van Outen and Johnny Vaughan, and Bobby, Jeff and Freddie Brazier share opinions on shows including Love Island, The Nevermets and The Yorkshire Vet. Plus, Shania Twains performance at Glastonbury, This Mornings feature on cuddle therapy and ITV News coverage of the Biden v Trump presidential debate. From July 2024

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a hybrid of the comedy panel show and the words-and-numbers quiz, as Sarah Millican and Josh Widdicombe take on Alan Carr and Thanyia Moore. Mathematician Rachel Riley looks after the letters and numbers, while comedy duo The Delightful Sausage join lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Jimmy Carrs I Literally Just Told You
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts this game show in which contestants Kristian, Heather, Seong-Jae and Ayame are given every answer with the questions written, literally, as the show is happening. With each correct answer adding more cash to their prize pot, the competitors have to keep their focus and remember the things theyve seen and heard just minutes before. Will a surprise visit from Barry Scott (aka actor Neil Burgess), a barn owl and an audience of Wheres Wally lookalikes hold the clues to unlock the cash?

programme.title: The Serpent Queen
programme.sub-title: To War Rather Than To Bed
programme.desc: Young Catherine faces challenges to securing her status and producing an heir to the throne as Henri is only interested in his mistress, Diane. Catherine begins to have visions of the future and realises that she must urgently become pregnant, in order to stay in the royal household

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The founder and president of the Tilted Kilt Pub and Eatery chain of sports bars hopes to see how his staff operate by posing as a failed business owner taking part in a bogus reality TV show. Ron Lynch goes undercover to make sure his companys principles are being implemented by his corporate and kitchen staff alike

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Los Angeles to help La Frite, an outdated French restaurant that is failing to make any profits. His first step is to try to reconcile the feuding family members who run the business, and so devises a plan to bring them together by using secret filming

programme.title: Sarah Beenys New Life in the Country
programme.desc: Spring arrives and after months of lockdown, the boys are all heading back to school, meaning Graham can get stuck in to project managing the house build. He and Sarah are planning a large dining room for entertaining, with a centrepiece table that used to belong to rock star Ronnie Wood. Artist Graham also draws on his skills to apply some decorative touches to the room - but will it be theatrical enough for Sarah? Meanwhile, the couple also visit a pig farmer who shows them the cycle from piglet to pork chop

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Emma and Nigel Forde and their three boys have lived in their Essex house for the past seven years, but after a bad experience with a bathroom fitting they have let the maintenance of the family home slide, which means broken kitchen doors and some rather unusual curtains. Nigel thinks its time to wave the white flag and sell up, but Emma wants some real investment to turn around the house she loves. Kirstie Allsopp has plenty of refurbishment ideas, while Phil Spencer has already found some viable replacement homes to buy. Will the Fordes decide to stay or go?

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: The Heffernans reminisce about moving into their house 10 years previously - and recall how Carrie had a tough job convincing a reluctant Doug, who was opposed to the change

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Arthur wins $2,500 at a bingo game, but his decision to share part of his winnings with Doug and Carrie comes with its own set of rules - he will decide how they spend it. American comedy, starring Kevin James, Leah Remini and Jerry Stiller

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Deacon and Kelly agree to babysit for Arthur to allow Carrie and Doug to spend some time together, but fail to heed their warning about the perils of spicy food. With Leah Remini and Jerry Stiller

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra gets a job, filling Ray with dread at the thought of having to take responsibility for all the household chores while she is at work

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Ray are taken aback to realise they are much nicer to strangers than to each other, and decide to show a little more mutual consideration in future - but their resolve soon crumbles. American comedy, guest starring Kevin James as Doug Heffernan, his character in The King of Queens

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert begins taking Debra out swing dancing, but Ray feels they are becoming too close and schemes to break up their partnership. Comedy, starring Ray Romano

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier attend the closing of Martins favourite bar, but are shocked to discover it is being demolished by a company they have invested in. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink makes a disparaging on-air remark about Seattles weather, causing outrage across the city. He offers to host a charity benefit to make up for his careless words - but the event only leads to further trouble. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin makes an election broadcast on behalf of Seattle mayoral hopeful Holden Thorpe, prompting Frasier and Niles to throw their weight behind a rival candidate - who proves highly unsuitable for public office. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, with the guest voice of Sydney Pollack

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part one of two. While visiting the island of Bora Bora with new girlfriend Madeline, Frasier is unexpectedly reunited with his ex-wife Lilith. Comedy, guest starring JoBeth Williams and Bebe Neuwirth

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The team discover a stash of unusual micro-cars. Plus, when Frank Fritz meets a fellow Frank, it is a match made in picking heaven

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Midday news summary

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: Stefan and his sous chef Billy kick off the week in Essex with restaurant classics at Toulouse. However, the king scallops and goats cheese salad starters come under fire from the couple who could be this weeks pickiest guests. Next up, Kaps and Satin offer salmon at their traditional country pub, The Bull and Willow Room. The final night gives Matt and Molly the chance to show off Matts premium culinary skills in the kitchen at the Shepherd and Dog

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In north Wales, Simon OBrien and Henry Cole meet Anne and her grandson Tom. Simon unearths an art deco fire guard

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Pam Ayres in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Anne-Marie and Adrian have been going to Los Cristianos in southern Tenerife for 12 years and consider it their second home. They would love to buy their very own holiday home there for a maximum budget of £160,000. Jean Johansson shows them five properties, hoping at least one will be perfect enough for Anne-Marie and Adrian to put in an offer

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: Becci and Micheal from Doncaster are beginning to turn a run-down Portuguese quinta into a family home. Louise and Paul are turning a storm-damaged 300-year-old French hamlet into a holiday village, and Ivano and Traceys renovation of a trulli village in Puglia in southern Italy has halted after they discovered a large crack in one of the ancient buildings

programme.title: The Great BandB Challenge
programme.desc: Six couples compete to win a five-bedroom BandB in the heart of rural France. In the first episode, three of the couples take the keys to rental properties they will run as BandBs for the week. They each have just a few hours to furnish and dress the rooms ready for their first guests arrival

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps a couple from Kent with two teenage daughters to find a perfect beachside holiday home around Spains Costa Almería, which must have a communal pool

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Rory Peck Awards
programme.sub-title: Wil Davies - Crisis in Sudan: The Fight for Survival
programme.desc: Wil Davis talks about the devastation, and the tiny strands of hope, that he encountered while filming among the thousands of people displaced by the brutal civil war in Sudan. Davis is a finalist for the Rory Peck Awards 2025, which celebrates the freelance film-makers who bring the worlds stories to our screens

programme.title: Inside The Worlds Most Luxurious Motorhomes
programme.desc: A world of extraordinary motorhomes that redefine life on the road, with bespoke interiors, cutting-edge innovation, and price tags that rival supercars and private jets. In Silverstone, rising F1 star Ollie Bearman invites us inside his Hungarian-built £1.2 million motorhome-from-home. Plus, a look behind the scenes at a state-of-the-art factory producing multi-million-pound celebrity motorhomes for clients including Lady Gaga, Olivia Rodrigo and the Foo Fighters

programme.title: Summerwater
programme.desc: Annie makes tough decisions, prompting David to do something unthinkable. Meanwhile, Becky pushes Gavin to his limits, insistent on finding out who he really is and what he saw in the strange bothy. As truths come to light, Becky finds herself in a difficult position, and Gavin reveals his dangerous side

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A mother-of-three is in resus after a severe asthma attack. As she is treated, the programme reveals how she has coped with life as a teenage mother with serious health problems. After falling in the street, 94-year-old Vera receives treatment for a head and elbow injury, and 27-year-old Josh has a potentially serious neck injury following a collision during an American football match

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: This edition focuses on a mothers role in different family units. Jacob, 20, arrives in resus with suspected internal bleeding after crashing his car into a wall at high speed, while Joan, 82, is treated for a head wound after tripping down the stairs at home, and seven-year-old Jackson has a suspected infection on his cheek. Documentary following life inside the AandE department of St Georges in south-west London, focusing on patients, their families and the staff dealing with the emergencies

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: An air ambulance is dispatched to the island of Mull, where 23-year-old rally driver Scott has rolled his car down a 20-foot embankment. In Glasgow city centre, the trauma team fight to save the life of a man who was hit by a bus and dragged under the wheels, while the coast guard helicopter flies to a remote sea loch to rescue a woman who has fallen 15 feet down a waterfall

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.sub-title: Lido, Anna Vincenzos and Le Bistro
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the restaurants he tried to save, returning to Lido, Anna Vincenzos and Le Bistro to find out whether his advice has been put to good use

programme.title: The Serpent Queen
programme.desc: Young Prince Henri returns from war with a new mistress and a baby. Diane convinces the young woman to leave, while Catherine tells a soothsayer that she must become pregnant at any cost. She is offered guidance, but a warning that there will be a price to be paid

programme.title: The Serpent Queen
programme.desc: Catherine eventually becomes a mother, but during a difficult birth, her twins do not survive. King Francis falls from his horse while hunting with Henri and Catherine

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: In Tenerife, squatters are taking over homes prompting hotels and property owners to turn to hard-man evictors to get them out. The Canary Islands attract 16 million tourists a year, but a deepening housing crisis is turning the Spanish region into a battleground, as people who say they can no longer afford soaring rents are occupying other peoples properties instead. Under Spanish law, once people occupy a property for 48 hours, a court order is needed to evict them - and this can take years. Reporter Anja Popp joins a controversial new force of private eviction teams employed by property owners

programme.title: Sunny Bunnies
programme.sub-title: I Dont Want to Be a Donkey!
programme.desc: Turbo, Hopper, Boo, Iris and Shiny dress up for a photo, but there may not be enough outfits for everyone

programme.desc: Pockets, Giggle and Spin visit a zoo as they want to see a tiger, and zookeeper Lucky Loover Bird takes them on safari, but the tigers wont come out of hiding

programme.desc: George feels left out of Peppa and Suzy Sheeps game

programme.desc: Wynona creates a fun game of follow the muddy maze to Mud Mountain, but as the friends play, new mountains keep mysteriously popping up

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family take a trip to the market to buy some lovely apples, cheese and fish. They get more than they were expecting when they stop by Mr Foxs stall - he is selling some extra special items

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The family heads to Paris, where the Donkeys take them to the top of the Eiffel Tower, but Daddy Pig does not like heights

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: Pip and Frankie get the sillybillies and begin acting very silly. Its fun until they take it too far and upset Posy. They remember a fix for the sillybillies and make it up to Posy

programme.sub-title: Paddington Digs a Tunnel to Peru
programme.desc: The bear decides to dig a tunnel through the centre of the Earth to Peru, but ends up in Mr Currys greenhouse

programme.desc: Mayor Humdinger fakes a broken toe in order to win a race, so the pups build him a mobility device

programme.desc: When nobody wants to listen to Harmonys dreadful music, Papa Smurf gives him a potion to charm his audience

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show
programme.desc: Patrick and GrandPat try to pass each other on the stairs, leading to a ludicrous conflict

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: A selection of funny moments taken from the singers series of programmes in which she voyages around parts of the world aboard some of the worlds largest and most luxurious cruise ships, as well as travelling along great rivers and lakes, taking in the sights and sounds of the places the vessels call in at

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The singer recalls two festive cruises in an edition featuring previously unseen footage. She starts on the SS Antoinette, travelling up the Rhine, then visits some of the worlds best Christmas markets sampling traditional food and drink and getting to grips with unique customs. The Wakefield wonder then goes in search for a Nordic Crimbo on board the Norwegian institution the Coastal Express. The Colts have won three of the last five meetings against the Chiefs, including a 19-13 triumph when they last played here in 2019. Tonights coverage will also feature the game within a game quiz element, whenever the NFL game stops in the US

programme.title: The 1970s Supermarket
programme.desc: As the supermarket scene of the 70s exploded, so did the ability for consumers to buy Christmas rather than make it. From artificial trees and plastic tinsel going on sale to the first-ever chocolate advent calendars hitting the shelves in 1971 and the new freezer stores packed with frozen turkey roasts, the decade saw a Christmas shopping revolution. In the kitchen, chef Rustie Lee rustles up vol-au-vents and Brussels pate, and tries out a Birds trifle kit, while in the lab, Dr Chris Clarke finds out why the cheesy filling inside a cheese football snack doesnt go off, how the gooey centre of an After Eight mint is created and why sprouts can give you wind

programme.title: Britains Favourite Christmas Adverts
programme.desc: Christmas: a time for giving - which is why advertisers pull out all the stops in a bid to persuade TV viewers to part with their hard-earned cash for the latest toys, gadgets, food, drink and whatever else they have to sell. This three-hour countdown recalls the advertising ghosts of past and present, 50 in total, from Action Man to Trivial Pursuit, the Stylophone to the Nintendo Wii, Paxo stuffing to Iceland platters and Hai Karate to Victoria Beckham Signature. With contributions from those who starred in the adverts and celebrities who were sufficiently convinced by the marketing messages to buy for their loved ones

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Bradley is on the mend following his rodeo injury and determined to get back behind the wheel of the RV. As the pair continue on their journey, Barney is thrilled to be celebrating his birthday with a trip to the iconic Niagara Falls. Later, Bradley and Barney take the RV on a small cargo ferry as they head to Vermont. Here, the pair have a go at ice climbing, which proves treacherous for them and the crew, before a spot of dog sledding through the frozen wilderness and an inevitable race through the forests

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: On the final leg of their journey, the pair continue through the snow to New Hampshire. Here, they meet rally-driving champion Tim ONeil who gives them a crash course in driving in the ice and snow before they take on an intense time trial. The pair travel on to Maine, where they take part in some wilderness training, before bidding farewell to the RV and heading out into the extremely choppy seas for some lobster fishing. Before heading home, the pair look back on some of their favourite moments from the trip

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three Cardiff couples compete to win £1,000 by throwing the perfect dinner part. First-time hosts Abi and Jake plan an American-themed menu. On night two, passionate vegans Ashleigh and Jack serve a fully plant-based menu designed to satisfy even the most committed meat eaters, but their rivals arent convinced that they can be converted. programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his two-part challenge at Mangia Mangia in Woodland Park, Colorado. In order to save the struggling Italian restaurant from disaster, he must persuade harassed owner Julie to co-operate with the head chef, and work his magic on a menu that relies heavily on a microwave

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family sees a different side to Grampa when he revisits his days as Gorgeous Godfrey - the most feared and villainous TV wrestler of all time. Mr Burns reveals he was a huge fan and persuades the old man to put on his spandex suit and return to the ring for one last fight

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Substitute teacher Mrs Cantwell (Tina Fey) takes an instant dislike to Lisa, and vows to give the youngster extra credit if she can figure out why. Meanwhile, Flanders is plagued with guilt after punching Homer. Featuring the guest voice of author Richard Dawkins

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is shocked at a revelation from Sheldon after she buys him a new laptop, while Raj sells out Leonard and Howard after they lie to their wives in order to attend an early screening of a movie. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: On a weekend cabin trip with Penny and Amy, Sheldon spills one of Leonards secrets, while Howard and Bernadette must draw a line when Raj goes overboard with pregnancy gifts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The gang members get together to have their family photo taken, with Gloria on hand to organise everyone. and Phil tracks down the record he lost his virginity to, but soon regrets it when it makes him feel as if hes being unfaithful to Claire. She, meanwhile, accuses Cameron of being a snob when he refuses her daughters hand-me-downs, and Jay enters Stella into a dog show

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cam worry about the growing cost of their wedding, so they agree to each sell a prized possession to earn some extra cash. Jay, Gloria and Manny challenge one another to step outside their comfort zones, involving traditional sausages, pickle and Stellas belly, while the Dunphy kids are in a mischievous mood after finding an old answering machine recording of Claire breaking the news that shes pregnant

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny share an intimate moment as they recover from a psychological deconstruction by the physicists mother, an expert in psychiatry and neural sciences. Guest starring Mamma Mia! actress Christine Baranski

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Tensions between Sheldon and Penny reach a new high after a paintballing accident leaves an ugly stain on the awkward physicists favourite sofa cushion. Meanwhile, romance blossoms between Leslie and Howard. Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon, Howard and Raj discover actress Summer Glau is on their train while travelling to San Francisco. Desperate to discuss the Terminator TV series with her, the friends devise a number of plans to engage her in conversation. With Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny starts her own hair accessories business and the orders start to pile in. However, she makes the mistake of asking Sheldon to help, leading to frustration and regret. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Demons, Sunday School and Prime Numbers
programme.desc: A worried Mary sends Sheldon off to Sunday school after she finds him playing Dungeons and Dragons with Tam and Billy, but Sheldon is soon inspired to study a variety of religions. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Computer, a Plastic Pony and a Case of Beer
programme.desc: The youngster asks for a computer and unknowingly sparks a heated argument between his parents over the familys finances, prompting Mary and the twins to move in with Meemaw. Iain Armitage stars

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: On a mission to play hardcore pranks, Bart, Nelson and Milhouse order Moe a mail-order bride from the Dark Web

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart feels neglected when Homer and Lisa bond over To Kill a Mockingbird and start spending quality time together, so Marge tries to help her husband divide his attentions equally

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldons flat is burgled, so they work on a state-of-the-art security system in a bid to outwit any future would-be thieves. However, their plans go awry when they ensnare Penny in a net. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon develops a mental block and has difficulty working on a formula, so in a move inspired by Albert Einstein he gets a job at the Cheesecake Factory diner to try to revive his creativity - and despite Pennys objections, proves surprisingly effective in the role. Guest starring Yeardley Smith (The voice of Lisa Simpson)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is invited to visit the Large Hadron Collider in Switzerland and asks Penny to join him as a Valentines Day treat. However, Sheldon tries to persuade the couple to allow him to take her place

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon misses an opportunity to meet Spider-Man co-creator Stan Lee when he has to go to court for driving through a red light, and his anger leads to his imprisonment. Penny finds out the address of the comic-book writer and takes Sheldon there - but his troubles with the law have yet to reach their conclusion and the visit does not go as expected

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns sets out to be reunited with his beloved teddy bear, which he lost as a child. Unfortunately, it is now owned by Maggie, presenting Homer with an unenviable dilemma. Featuring the voices of the Ramones

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer sells his soul to the Devil in return for a doughnut, a gremlin attacks Ottos bus while Bart is on his way to school, and the family sets out to end a vampiric Mr Burns reign of terror

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Warren tries his best to support Mercedes, but his scorned ex-girlfriend is never far away. Guilt consumes one resident, Frankie opens up about her past, and a new mum continues to struggle

programme.title: Animal Control
programme.desc: Frank gets frustrated with finding women on dating apps and asks Emily to set him up on an old-fashioned in-person date

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: The remaining contestants pose on a flaming catwalk, and are later paired up to film coffee commercials with photographer and director Francesco Carrozzini

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Strictly Come Dancing, Coronation Street, Antiques Roadshow, Frozen Planet II, Kings of Pain, Help! My House Is Haunted, Only Connect, and ITV News coverage of the mini-budget

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Bad Sisters, Nadiyas Everyday Baking, The Kardashians, Super/Natural, Emma Willis: Delivering Babies, and A Trip to Infinity, as well as BBC News reports on the energy cap and a U-turn by Kwasi Kwarteng. First broadcast in October 2022

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Part-time wrestler Lewis, 19, returns to the restaurant for a second chance as he sits down with 20-year-old barista Lauren, while hotel inspector Alasdair, 55, and 54-year-old DJ Lee bond over their shared love of pop music. Stu, whos 42, lost his sight 13 years ago and hopes to meet a redhead to settle down with, and his date is 37-year-old Bristol nurse Jen, who has been single for eight years and is looking for a man to ignite the flames of love

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard tries to get Sheldon into the Christmas mood by playing a game, but things do not go as planned when Sheldon reveals a childhood trauma. Raj goes out with the girls and reveals he had crushes on both Penny and Bernadette - but not Amy. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is not pleased when his assistant Alex starts flirting with Leonard and has a word with her about it. Unfortunately, his comments are so inappropriate that he is accused of sexual harassment and sent to the universitys human resources department, where he ends up dragging Leonard, Raj and Howard into trouble too. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin splurges on an expensive jacket, then worries its too special to risk wearing outside the house. Dave and Gemma worry their new friends daughter is a bad influence

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin and Dave are both chosen to serve as jurors on the same trial. And Malcolm and Marty get a big surprise when they rent out their house for a film shoot

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Lost Land of the Tiger
programme.desc: The expedition shifts to high altitude in the mountains of Bhutan as Gordon Buchanan captures footage of a snow leopard cub at more than 5,000m, while his heat-sensing camera picks up a big cat stalking through the camp in darkness. Steve Backshall treks to Tiger Mountain along the Tibetan border, where a remote tribe helps provide a close encounter with an elusive predator. As the expedition concludes, the team presents its findings to the Bhutanese prime minister

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Scientists, climbers and wildlife film-makers explore the rainforests of Guyana, a former British colony in South America. Cameraman Gordon Buchanan finds giant otters almost as large as he is, canopy expert Justine Evans observes a family of red howler monkeys, and biologist Steve Backshall probes a habitat below a massive waterfall where frogs and freshwater crabs happily co-exist

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: The team travels deeper into the Guyanan jungle and scorpions and poisonous centipedes enter the base camp. Gordon Buchanan discovers an animal is stealing supplies and Steve Backshall finds giant piranha and long-fanged sabretooth fish in the river. Meanwhile, George McGavin catches an enormous tarantula and the climbing team tries to scale a huge unclimbed mountain at the forests edge

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Steve Backshall reaches the summit of a table-top mountain, after climbing a vertical cliff face nearly as high as the Empire State Building. Meanwhile, Dr George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan have to haul three boats and all their kit through the jungle after finding the rapids of the Rewa River impassable. At the end of the journey, George presents a report on the expedition to the President of Guyana, Bharrat Jagdeo

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers the secrets of Cornwalls Tintagel, famed as the legendary birthplace of King Arthur. Ben discovers Tintagel was potentially more important than London a thousand years ago, based on recent evidence unearthed at an archaeological dig overseen by English Heritage. It was found that over 2,000 people were living here which, at the time, which would have made it the largest settlement anywhere of its kind in Britain
