Just when she thinks her situation could not get any worse, the spirit of a dead teenager begins to haunt her. Psychological horror, starring Halle Berry, Robert Downey Jr, Penelope Cruz and Bernard Hill

programme.title: Zombieland: Double Tap
programme.desc: A decade after they joined forces, survivors Tallahassee, Columbus, Wichita and Little Rock have become experts in identifying and disposing assorted zombies. They set up their new home in the abandoned White House, but after Little Rock heads to Graceland, the team attempts to save her from a group of super zombies. Director Ruben Fleischers comedy horror sequel, starring Woody Harrelson, Jesse Eisenberg and Emma Stone

programme.title: Resident Evil: Afterlife
programme.desc: Zombie-fighting heroine Alice roams the post-apocalyptic wasteland searching for human survivors. An encounter with an old friend leads her to a rumoured sanctuary in Los Angeles, but she discovers she has walked into a deadly trap and must once again battle the hordes of the living dead. Action horror sequel, starring Milla Jovovich, Ali Larter and Wentworth Miller

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A journalist investigates several teenage deaths, which are linked to a cursed videotape and the rumour that anyone who watches it will die a week later. Her growing obsession with the tape endangers herself and her family - and to avoid the predicted fate, she has just seven days to find out where the recording came from. Gore Verbinskis remake of the Japanese supernatural horror, starring Naomi Watts, Martin Henderson and Brian Cox

programme.title: The Ring 2
programme.desc: Journalist Rachel Keller and her son try to rebuild their shattered lives, moving from Seattle to Oregon and starting afresh. However, the vengeful spirit of Samara follows, and this time she is determined to destroy them. Sequel to the horror remake, starring Naomi Watts, Simon Baker and David Dorfman, and featuring a cameo appearance from Sissy Spacek

programme.title: Children of Men
programme.desc: In a future blighted by mass infertility, the human race is one generation from extinction and the world has plunged into chaos. In a totalitarian Britain, a jaded former activist tries to protect the first woman to become pregnant in nearly 20 years. However, a militant underground group plans to use her for its own ends. Thriller, starring Clive Owen, Michael Caine and Julianne Moore

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: A father tries to resurrect his dead son by placing him in an enchanted burial ground but the plan backfires with devastating results. Horror, starring Dale Midkiff, Fred Gwynne and Denise Crosby, with a cameo appearance by author Stephen King, whose book provided the basis for the film

programme.title: Marlowe
programme.desc: Los Angeles, 1939, and private detective Philip Marlowe is hired to find the ex-lover of a glamorous heiress. Director Neil Jordans conversion of John Banvilles novel The Black-Eyed Blonde, starring Liam Neeson as Raymond Chandlers iconic sleuth. Diane Kruger and Jessica Lange also star

programme.title: Last Seen Alive
programme.desc: Will Spann is driving his soon-to-be ex-wife Lisa to her parents home when she mysteriously disappears without a trace during a stop at a gas station. A frantic Will engages the local police and Lisas parents in a desperate attempt to find her, but as time passes and suspicion falls on him, he must take matters into his own hands, delving into the towns criminal underbelly while running from the authorities in a race against time. Thriller, with Gerard Butler and Jaimie Alexander

programme.title: Oceans Eleven
programme.desc: A suave ex-convict assembles a gang of sophisticated crooks to pull off a daring heist. He intends to rob three of Las Vegass biggest casinos simultaneously - and also win back his estranged wife, who is now dating the ruthless owner of all three gambling establishments. Steven Soderberghs crime comedy, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Bernie Mac

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: A Los Angeles taxi driver picks up a sharp-suited fare and is shocked when a dead body almost plunges through his windscreen during the first stop on the journey. The enigmatic passenger then reveals he is a hitman with four more contracts to carry out before the night is over, and forces the driver to help him. Michael Manns thriller, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Murder by Numbers
programme.desc: Two teenagers murder a random victim for their own amusement, convinced nobody will ever suspect them of committing such a senseless crime, and ensure all the evidence points to a drug dealer. However, they reckon without a suspicious and determined detective and her partner. Thriller, starring Sandra Bullock, Ryan Gosling and Michael Pitt

programme.title: Layer Cake
programme.desc: A London cocaine dealer is all set to leave the criminal world behind and start a new life abroad. However, his plans are thwarted when he is asked to track down a gangsters drug-addicted daughter and locate a stolen shipment of Ecstasy. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney, Kenneth Cranham and Sienna Miller

programme.title: Oceans Twelve
programme.desc: The crooks reunite when an old enemy catches up with them and demands they repay the money they stole from him three years previously. In response, the gang comes up with another larcenous plan - but reckons without the interventions of a fellow thief and a sultry Interpol agent. Crime caper sequel, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Don Cheadle

programme.title: The Bikeriders
programme.desc: Truck driver Johnny is inspired to establish the Vandals motorcycle club in 1960s Chicago. He assembles a motley crew, including Brucie, Benny, Cal and Zipco. Exuberant outsider Kathy falls under Bennys spell, and they marry, but when the groom is the victim of a violent assault, Johnny exacts revenge, while Kathy fights for her husbands tormented soul. Drama, starring Tom Hardy, Jodie Comer and Austin Butler

programme.title: Hannibal
programme.desc: Fugitive serial killer Dr Hannibal Lecter has gone into hiding as an academic in Italy, but a disfigured victim is determined to find him and inflict a gruesome revenge. FBI agent Clarice Starling is once again drawn into the doctors deadly orbit as she finds herself being used as bait for the avengers trap. Ridley Scotts thriller sequel, starring Anthony Hopkins, Julianne Moore, Gary Oldman and Ray Liotta

programme.title: The Godfather
programme.desc: The patriarch of the Corleone crime family is hospitalised after an attempt on his life and entrusts control of his business to his three sons - the violent and unpredictable Sonny, the weak-willed Fredo, and Michael, the youngest brother, who reluctantly takes up the reins but proves to be the most ruthless of them all. Francis Ford Coppolas gangster drama, starring Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, John Cazale, Talia Shire, Robert Duvall and Diane Keaton

programme.title: Paradise Highway
programme.desc: Sally is a truck driver who is forced to smuggle illegal cargo to save her brother from a lethal prison gang. programme.title: Caddo Lake
programme.desc: The disappearance of an eight-year-old girl ties together a series of past deaths and disappearances, as well as bringing the truth about a broken familys history into the light. Thriller written and directed by Logan George and Celine Held, starring Dylan OBrien and Eliza Scanlen

programme.title: Extremely Wicked, Shockingly Evil and Vile
programme.desc: The life of aspiring lawyer Ted Bundy is examined from the perspective of his longtime girlfriend, Elizabeth Kloepfer, who refused to believe that her partner was one of Americas most prolific serial killers. Director Joe Berlingers biopic, starring Zac Efron, Lily Collins, Kaya Scodelario, John Malkovich and Angela Sarafyan

Crime thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney, Kenneth Cranham and Sienna Miller

Crime caper sequel, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Don Cheadle

programme.title: Oceans Thirteen
programme.desc: Danny Ocean rounds up his band of crooks for one last heist. He plans a scheme that will leave Bank penniless, but needs the help of an old enemy. Comedy crime caper sequel, with George Clooney, Al Pacino, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia, Don Cheadle and Elliott Gould

Drama, starring Tom Hardy, Jodie Comer and Austin Butler

programme.title: Tina (2021)
programme.desc: Born Anna Mae Bullock in 1939, Tina Turner has sold in excess of 100 million records and earned numerous plaudits including Grammy awards and induction into the Rock And Roll Hall Of Fame with her first husband, Ike Turner. She was the first woman to grace the cover of Rolling Stone magazine and dabbled in acting including a memorable performance opposite Mel Gibson in Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome. Following a prolonged period of ill health, Turner intends to retire from the spotlight with her second husband, Erwin Bach. She bids farewell to her fans in the emotional documentary Tina. Directed by Dan Lindsay and TJ Martin, the film invites the singer to reminisce about her turbulent life and career with glowing contributions from friends, family and fans including Oprah Winfrey and Angela Bassett

programme.title: A Ship Through Time
programme.sub-title: A Ship Through Time: Secrets of the Newport Ship
programme.desc: Part one of two. Sean Fletcher investigates the secrets of a shipwrecked 15th-century trading galleon found by accident off Newport in south Wales in 2002, her international significance and how two of Europes most turbulent and violent wars shaped her fate. He discovers what this trading galleon carried, and to where and a possible powerful owner. He also sheds light on a possible connection to the Wars of the Roses

programme.title: Matsalu Moose: Wild Giants of the Baltics
programme.desc: Matsalu National Park at the Baltic Sea is known for being one of Europes most important stopover places for migrating birds. However, few know that an exceptionally large moose colony also lives here. This documentary follows the moose through the eyes of two yearlings as they are chased away from their mother before she gives birth to the next calf

programme.title: The Big Dry

programme.title: Secret Life of the Koala

programme.title: Shark with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist joins scientists to find the shark hotspots in the Pacific Ocean, where their precious locations are under threat and numbers are plummeting. Steve learns what the sharks offer that is so important to the Pacific and what can be done to preserve them

programme.title: Shark: British Isles Special with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Naturalist Steve Backshall goes in search of some of the 30-plus shark species that inhabit waters of the British Isles, showing how the big fish in home waters are just as astonishing and mysterious as their global cousins. Along the way he encounters a four-ton basking shark near the Hebrides and dives with his favourite of all time, the blue shark, off the coast of Cornwall. He also meets scientists and conservationists in Wales who are working to protect endangered species

programme.title: David Attenborough Meets Obama
programme.desc: Another chance to see Barack Obamas conversation, recorded in May 2015, with renowned naturalist and film-maker David Attenborough. In a twist on usual convention, the then-US president took the role of interviewer, quizzing Attenborough about his thoughts on the future of the planet, their shared passion for nature, and potential ways to protect the environment. Also includes behind-the-scenes footage from Sir Davids latest project on the Great Barrier Reef, as well as highlights from throughout the veteran broadcasters career

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster reveals how life has learnt to adapt quickly in the ever-changing volcanic landscape, resulting in species that exist nowhere else in the world. David investigates the driving forces behind their evolution, exploring the appearance and behaviour of remarkable creatures and vegetation including giant whale sharks, marine iguanas and seemingly normal dandelion seeds that grow into plants the size of trees

programme.title: Live NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Toronto Raptors v Cleveland Cavaliers (Tip-off 12.00am). Coverage of the Eastern Conference match at Scotiabank Arena. Since winning the NBA title in 2019, the first in franchise history, the Raptors have been on something of a downward trajectory, and failed to reach the play-offs for a third consecutive season last year

programme.title: Live NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Phoenix Suns v Houston Rockets (Tip-off 2.30am). Coverage of the Western Conference match at Mortgage Matchup Center. Future Hall of Famer Kevin Durant was traded from the Suns to the Rockets during the off-season as part of a seven-team trade, the largest in NBA history, and will hope for a better reception than he received when visiting another of his former teams, Oklahoma City Thunder, on the opening night of the season, when he was roundly booed

programme.title: Live EFL
programme.desc: Sheffield Wednesday v Sheffield United (Kick-off 12.00pm). Coverage of the Championship match at Hillsborough. This fixture has been a low-scoring affair in recent years, with the Blades winning 1-0 in both encounters last season, and the three previous games all ending in 0-0 draws, but both clubs will be keen to give their fans something to sing about after a difficult time in recent months

programme.title: Live SPFL
programme.desc: Aberdeen v Hearts (Kick-off 3.00pm). Coverage of the Scottish Premiership match at Pittodrie, as the teams meet for the second time this season. programme.title: Live EFL
programme.desc: Sheffield Wednesday v Sheffield United (Kick-off 12.00pm). Coverage of the Championship match at Hillsborough. This fixture has been a low-scoring affair in recent years, with the Blades winning 1-0 in both encounters last season, and the three previous games all ending in 0-0 draws, but both clubs will be keen to give their fans something to sing about after a difficult time in recent months

programme.title: Live Super Sunday
programme.desc: Leeds United v Aston Villa (Kick-off 2.00pm). Coverage of the Premier League match at Elland Road, where the Whites will be looking to register a home win over the Villans for the first time since December 2016 when they triumphed 2-0 thanks to goals from Kemar Roofe and Chris Wood, when both teams were in the Championship

programme.title: Live Super Sunday
programme.desc: Arsenal v Tottenham Hotspur (Kick-off 4.30pm). Coverage of the Premier League match at Emirates Stadium, where the Gunners will be looking to extended a six-match unbeaten streak against their North London rivals. Mikel Artetas men won both of last seasons encounters, including a 2-1 triumph on home turf, after a Dominic Solanke own goal and a Leandro Trossard effort were enough to overturn an opener from Son Heung-Min

programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: Los Angeles Rams v Tampa Bay Buccaneers (Kick-off 1.20am). Coverage of the week 12 match at SoFi Stadium. Renamed Hope Castle in the 1850s, the castles gate lodge fell into disrepair with the passage of time. Carrie follows along as the local townspeople come together to reimagine the space

programme.title: Glacaim Leat
programme.desc: Reflective documentary marking a decade since Ireland made history in 2015, when it became the first country to legalise same-sex marriage by public referendum. Blending love story, political reckoning, and cultural memory, the film follows the people who helped shape that journey and those now living its legacy. Shot over a year and culminating at Dublin Pride 2025, the film is a reminder that Pride is still a protest. As more LGBTQ+ people say they no longer feel safe, the film challenges us to confront the gap between the promise of 2015 and the reality of today

programme.desc: Paul Murton returns to explore more of the nations lochs, beginning by heading to Wester Ross to find out about the heritage of Little Loch Broom. He then travels to the off-grid community of Scoraig, where he learns about violin making and wind power, before taking the plunge to explore the hidden depths of Corrieshalloch Gorge. programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer return to Scotland for their latest fishing trip. Having failed to catch a salmon in the River Tay, they hope to have more luck on the Tweed. They begin their journey at the isolated Bemersyde Estate before moving on to the Bridge Pool at Kelso, one of the most famous salmon fishing spots in Scotland. They also try their hand at boat fishing and receive some mystical predictions from a familiar face

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer are joined by singer and conservationist Feargal Sharkey for a trip to the River Lea in Hertfordshire, where Paul used to fish for perch with his friends when he was a teenager. Bob reads up on the wise words of 17th-century angler Izaak Walton and prepares a riverside picnic that brings back fond memories and leads to a reflection on the differences between teenage life in their 1970s youth and the present. Setting up home in a narrowbooat, he also prepares a dish Pauls mother used to make - corned beef and potato pie

programme.title: Guy Martins Battle of Britain
programme.desc: Part one of two. The presenter experiences the training of a Second World War fighter pilot, ultimately taking to the skies in a Hawker Hurricane for a dogfight against a Messerschmitt 109. In the first part, he learns how to fly in a Tiger Moth bi-plane, before progressing to the much faster Harvard aircraft and combat manoeuvres. He also tries his hand at clay pigeon shooting, which was used as a training exercise to help rookie pilots shoot fast-moving targets

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris, Freddie Flintoff and Paddy McGuinness get to grips with a disused hearse, and give it a new lease of life as the ultimate family car. On the track, Chris puts the Dallara Stradale through its paces, while royal couple Zara and Mike Tindall go head-to-head in Star in a Reasonably Fast Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness and Freddie Flintoff go on a jungle adventure in Borneo with the Gurkhas, in a pair of rare but very cheap old cars. Back in the studio, Chris Harris gets behind the wheel of the worlds most luxurious SUV, and the gang is joined by Bob Mortimer

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King explore the history behind the boom in pub food, tracing it from the humble beginnings of bar snacks and chicken-in-a-basket to the birth of the gastro pub. The duo also recreate some mouthwatering dishes that would make any publican proud

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: On the fourth leg of his journey through the continent, Simon travels through three of the worlds most extreme environments as he takes in the salt flats of Bolivia, Brazils Pantanal wetland region and Paraguays Chaco Forest. In Bolivia, he meets a family making a living carving salt from the vast white expanse of the Uyuni flats, while in Brazil he has a close encounter with South Americas apex predator, the jaguar. In Paraguay, Simon visits a Mennonites school, where traditionally clothed children are drilled in Bible texts and there are no smartphones to be seen

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: The last leg of Simons journey through South America takes him from Chiles Atacama Desert right down to Tierra Del Fuego, the most southerly inhabited place on Earth. In the Atacama, one of the driest places on the planet with is as little as 1mm of rain per year, Simon discovers shocking evidence of human pollution

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake journeys on some of the most perilous routes in the world. In Alaska, Sue Perkins and Charley Boorman drive along the notorious Dalton Highway, a dirt track originally constructed in the 1970s as a supply road for the Trans-Alaska oil pipeline. The pair struggle to cope with the Arctic conditions and constant threat of avalanches, but receive help from experienced truckers who teach them some unwritten rules for surviving the roads many hazards

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Cornwall has more than its fair share of folktales. Perhaps the most famous is found near Lands End, where Rick recounts the tale of the Mermaid of Zennor. A short distance away, he joins a small army of seaweed harvesters who are feeding an increasing appetite for a natural food more common in Japan

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick roams the dramatic north Cornish coast to tell the story of one of Britains best-loved writers, Thomas Hardy, and his little-known love affair with a Cornishwoman. Another famous writer, Dylan Thomas, once dubbed Ricks next stop, Mousehole, as the loveliest village in Britain. Its here that Rick discovers the origins of the iconic Cornish dish stargazy pie

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade returns with the offbeat tourism show and is joined in the first edition by comedy actress and writer Dawn French, with the pair spending two days in the Greek capital. Their mini-break features doughnuts, the Acropolis and the thermal waters of Lake Vouliagmeni, which is rumoured to be the goddess Athenas favourite bathing spot. Richard and Dawn sample a 14-course tasting menu at a temple to molecular gastronomy, before they go on an Olympic tour featuring discus and javelin training

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A local boy goes missing, and Burnside is forced to turn to a convicted paedophile for help in finding him

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sun Hill has a bomb scare when a device is discovered in the park. Jeff Stewart stars

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is gripped by an outbreak of dysentery, but thats the least of mum-to-be Marie Amoss worries when her husband Tony is arrested for gross indecency in the gentlemens toilets and faces a criminal hearing. Nurse Crane meets Dolores McEvoy, a pregnant Irish woman who is clearly malnourished - but when she visits the womans home, it turns out she has given a false address and has disappeared. Trixie is delighted when Tom asks her to oversee her first official church duty since their engagement, while at Nonnatus House, Fred tackles a rat infestation - only for Sister Monica Joan to work against him. With guest appearances by Cara Theobold (Downton Abbey) and Richard Fleeshman (Coronation Street)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Winifreds eyes are opened to Poplars seedy underworld when she cares for expectant prostitute Bridget Cole. Horrified by the young womans lack of awareness, she draws on her teaching experience, and with help from Sgt Noakes sets out to promote safe sex to all local working girls. Barbara struggles to understand why expectant father Frank Robbins would pressure his wife to bear him a son, while Sister Monica Joan is feeling sidelined - until she finds herself unexpectedly assisting Shelagh with an emergency birth. Trixie invites herself along to a meeting between Tom and the Bishop - but things get tense when the idea of the couple moving to Newcastle is raised

programme.title: Catherine Cooksons A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: First in a two-part drama, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. The youngster soon makes friends with a local girl and the future looks rosy - but heartbreak is waiting just around the corner. With Tim Healy, Jonathan Kerrigan and Michael Jayston

programme.title: Last Tango in Halifax
programme.desc: Derek Jacobi and Anne Reid return as the second-time-around lovers in Sally Wainwrights award-winning comedy drama, which picks up where the last series left off, with Alan regaining consciousness after his heart scare. Celia is so relieved, she promises never to fall out with him again - and realising life is too short, the couple decide to get married as soon as possible. Things arent quite so rosy between Caroline and John, however - having arrived home to find him in bed with Judith, she decides to go one better and invites Kate to move in. Meanwhile, Gillians relationship with her father takes a knock when he discovers she slept with John. Sarah Lancashire, Nicola Walker, Tony Gardner and Nina Sosanya co-star

programme.title: Hotel Portofino

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Leo, Nikki and Jack travel to war-torn Afghanistan to identify whether human remains are those of a missing British soldier suspected of being captured by Taliban forces five years earlier. However, they soon discover there is more at stake than identifying a soldiers remains as the crime scene is preventing the completion of a charity-run sanitation plant, putting thousands of lives at risk from contaminated water. William Gaminara, Emilia Fox and David Caves star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceaseds widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husbands business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook

programme.desc: A woman approaches Ronnie about assisting the suicide of her terminally ill father, and Vivien suggests Julia claim back her maiden name. Medical drama, starring Sean Gleeson, Anita Carey and Diane Keen

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Lisa visits a remote farmhouse to assist a home birth, but complications put the mothers life in danger and leave the midwife with a difficult decision _ whether to wait for an ambulance or break strict rules by driving the patient to hospital in her own car. Meanwhile, Mubbs learns that a former lover has contracted a sexually transmitted disease _ which means he may have passed it on to Lisa

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Zoe nervously prepares to tell Sharice she plans to foster her. Alex conspires to get Adam out of the way when he comes to a momentous decision that tests the departments entire staff, while Curtis and Alices romantic picnic is interrupted by a frantic father whose son has been injured

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rawton goes undercover as a lonely heart to trace a killer preying on vulnerable women

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: As Bradley defends Dot, Nick and Dotty plan her imminent demise. Billy saves Jay, but can he bring Jases killer to justice? Jack promises to give Ronnie what she needs

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dotty and Nicks plan comes to fruition despite Bradleys interference. Garry is hiding a secret. Bianca gets what-for from Pat. Christian takes control of the Beale empire

programme.title: Miss Fishers Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: An actor dies during a production of Gilbert and Sullivan operetta Ruddigore, and the unusual circumstances pose sleuth Phryne Fisher with another difficult case. She also visits Chinatown both to investigate its illicit trade in opium and meet the handsome Lin Chung. Essie Davis stars in the crime drama set in 1920s Melbourne

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: The legacy of Paul and Lexies secret kiss strains relations between them, but despite initial reservations, she reconsiders her decision to leave Glenbogle. Duncan decides the time is right for him to make changes in his life, and steps in to help a begrudging Ewan out when an accident incapacitates him. Meanwhile, Duncan and Molly reveal details of a hidden past that threaten to have dramatic implications for the rest of the family

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim sets out to prove the French police were wrong to accuse a man of murdering his wife. John Nettles plays the Jersey detective

programme.title: The Upper Hand
programme.desc: Charlie becomes jealous of Carolines new creative director when they start spending a lot of time together, and conjures up thoughts he is using her so that he can steal her business. Martin Clunes guest stars, with Joe McGann and Diana Weston

programme.title: Terry and June
programme.desc: The warring couple have problems when wardrobes are fitted in their bedroom. Terry Scott and June Whitfield star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick judge finds his principles tested by the offer of a place on the Appellate Bench in return for hushing up a diplomatic incident. Convinced that an Arab sheikhs driver is covering for his boss over the murder of a prostitute, he is forced to decide whether to see justice done or yield to the temptation of the bribe and back off in the national interest. Drama, starring Martin Shaw

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceaseds widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husbands business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook

programme.desc: Part one of two. Boyd investigates a disturbing case of abuse and murder at a childrens home as new evidence comes to light about the disappearance of two boys. Festive special from 1997, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Caroline Quentin and Leslie Ash

programme.desc: George agrees to be a surrogate parent for a childless Ultronian couple but disaster looms when Janet sets her heart on keeping the baby - until she sees what it looks like. Comedy, starring Ardal OHanlon and Emily Joyce

programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Its Christmas Day and Richard and Adam help a family who tragically face the loss of a loved one, while Dan and Becky are called out to a baby with a worryingly high temperature

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Boxing Day arrives and paramedics Deena Evans and Mike Hipgrave race to 71-year-old Frank, who has severe chest pains and has had difficulty breathing after going shopping

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Loz and Dave are called to a hotel where a young man has been struck down with abdominal pain, while Stu and Rob treat a man with breathing difficulties who has a detachable ear

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Its New Years Eve, one of the busiest days for the West Midlands crews. Gaz and Liam help a man whose celebrations were cut short when he was hit in the head by a firework

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: As the New Year starts Simon and Fiona are called to a pregnant woman who is bleeding, while Joe and Hannah race to a young woman who has been self-harming

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Spaniel Scrumpy is suffering from lameness and Noel discovers he has a collapsed disc and severe elbow arthritis. He already has a chequered medical history totalling six previous operations to his elbows, hip and knee. Meanwhile, there is an emergency admission when a 15-month-old dachshund arrives with a mystery brain condition, and Noel and his neurology colleagues have their work cut out to identify the cause. When his condition rapidly deteriorates overnight, suddenly the life of this much-loved young dog hangs in the balance

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Four-year-old pug and beagle cross Barney is brought into Fitzpatrick Referrals after being hit by a bus. The dog has lost 40 per cent of the bone in the damaged leg, so Noel creates an innovative two-tier treatment, involving an external ankle frame for support. Sisters Rosemary and Diane bring in their five-year-old basset hound Albert when they find he is suddenly unable to move his back legs, and 10-month-old Labrador cross Gylly receives treatment for lameness and an unusual bone deformity

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets a litter of puppies known as the Potato Pups, who were found abandoned in a crisp box, and helps the staff fight to keep them alive

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Ann and Steve are called to help a woman and it becomes clear shes having a heart attack and needs surgery. Stuart and Craig treat a woman who may be having an allergic reaction

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Sam and Joel help a man who has just found out hes been exposed to HIV, while Nic and Carla visit a lady who has a painful infected foot following surgery

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Three-year-old Isaac needs an operation on his tongue, a woman has her toes straightened and part of a toe amputated, and a man has biopsies taken from his prostate

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Nigel has keyhole surgery to repair his hernia - but things go wrong when hes back on the ward. Carol has a pin removed from her ankle, which was previously fractured

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Its all hands on deck as Southmead Hospitals maternity ward reaches maximum capacity, and the midwives are concerned that the unit may have to close. Among the new arrivals are Mormon couple Jennie and Jon, who are expecting their third child, and nervous first-time parents Eve and Andy, who experienced difficulties during their two previous pregnancies

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives of Liverpool Womens Hospital invite viewers into the delivery suites one last time, introducing 27-year-old Gina and her partner James. The pair met at university, while Gina was on an exchange programme from Shanghai, and made their long-distance relationship work by chatting through cuddly toys via the internet. However, they must now demonstrate their maturity and become parents. Meanwhile, self-confessed baby machine Margy arrives expecting her fifth child, and childhood sweethearts Craig and Sarah, who faced parenthood at an early age, look forward to taking their next baby back to their own home rather than to their parents

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Forty-six-year-old Mel only found out as a teenager that she was conceived using a sperm donor. Now she wants to see if she can find her biological fathers identity by decoding her DNA, and discovers far more than she ever expected. Fi always knew she was adopted, but what she didnt know until later in life was that her father murdered her birth mother. Fi wants to know if it possible to inherit a murder gene. Presented by Stacey Dooley

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: A new boyfriend boasting a selection of lost Beatles recordings makes Eddie think shes hit the big time, but her plans to marry him and invite an elite group of producers to hear the tapes are dashed in spectacular fashion. Elton John and Robert Lindsay guest star

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: TV presenter Myleene Klass opens a new birthing pool at the hospital, and delivery suite manager Gail Wright worries about the event running smoothly. Flight attendant Helen and her boyfriend Alan are preparing to give up their lifestyle of travel and partying when their twin boys arrive. Trevor and Natalie, who have had a difficult relationship, prepare for the birth of their third child, while Hasan cannot stand to hear his partner Dianes screams during labour, and keeps leaving the room

programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Cirencester, Gloucestershire, to help the Beasleys finish work on an incomplete extension to their former council house. programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Years of bad luck and illness have left the Wrights unable to finish converting their bungalow in Ottery St Mary, east Devon, into a four-bedroom family home. With this in mind, Nick Knowles enlists the aid of local tradespeople and guest designer Charlie Luxton to help them complete the project

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Guest designer Charlie Luxton joins Nick Knowles and the team in Stoke-on-Trent, where they meet terminally ill Haydn Spice and his family. Nick rallies friends, relatives and local traders to turn their property, which resembles a building site, into a comfortable home

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Cirencester, Gloucestershire, to help the Beasleys finish work on an incomplete extension to their former council house. The project has taken a back seat to ill health and loss of work over the previous five years, leaving the family on the brink of despair, so local tradespeople, members of the community and designer Charlie Luxton are enlisted to help with the build

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Years of bad luck and illness have left the Wrights unable to finish converting their bungalow in Ottery St Mary, east Devon, into a four-bedroom family home. With this in mind, Nick Knowles enlists the aid of local tradespeople and guest designer Charlie Luxton to help them complete the project

programme.title: MasterChef USA
programme.desc: The contestants must master one of the toughest desserts in the world - the beloved macaron

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete travels to Northern Ireland to pick up three stray dogs and bring them back to Essex. He also meets a Shar Pei who is in constant pain and may need surgery

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Golden retriever poodle-cross Sukis front legs have developed abnormally and now require urgent attention as the bones of her forearms are growing at different rates, so Noel decides that major surgery is required. Beloved elderly Labrador Raffa is nearly 11 and has become lame with constant pain in his front legs, and Noel discovers cartilage erosion in both elbows. Meanwhile, five-year-old dachshund Zizi is rushed in after suddenly losing the use of her back legs overnight, and an urgent MRI scan confirms that Zizi has suffered an exploded disc

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A couple bring their 13-month-old cocker spaniel puppy in for scheduled surgery for hip dysplasia which will require two separate full hip replacements. Elsewhere, two-year-old cat Jazz is rushed in by mum Sarah suffering from a smashed femur and shattered thorax after being hit by a car, and eight-year-old dachshund Olive is treated after suddenly losing the use of her back legs

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary returns to capture life in the maternity unit at Liverpool Womens Hospital. Students Brooke and Tim, both aged 23, who became inseparable when they met in their first term at university, become parents for the first time and have difficulty deciding on a name for their baby, while things dont go according to plan in theatre for 40-year-old Hayley. She is afraid of being separated from her 23-year-old partner Nick, after he became critically ill during the pregnancy as a result of contracting pneumonia and septicaemia. Meanwhile, Tara, aged 36, has chosen her 16-year-old daughter Courtney as her birthing partner

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Three more sets of parents-to-be arrive at Liverpool Womens Hospital to welcome new additions to their families, including 29-year-old Kate and her 32-year-old husband Pete, whose short-term memory was damaged following a hard-fought battle against meningitis and encephalitis 10 years earlier. The pair hope Petes brain injury will not stop him from being able to recall this memorable moment in the future. Also featured is third-time mother Lisa, whose previous two labours only lasted six and four hours respectively, and former drama school student Hayley, who already has children with her other-half Stephen, and has resolved to appreciate every moment with her family after losing her own mother at an early age

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Four more people test their DNA to help answer life-changing questions, including Clare, who wonders whether her Dad was a British soldier during the Troubles. Leigh only discovered that he might have a secret sister after his mum passed away, while it was only when Jenna and Ryan were pregnant that they realised they both carry a genetic mutation that could be deadly if passed on to their kids

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Saffy is persuaded to allow Patsy and Eddie to babysit for the day, allowing her to have some romantic time with John - unaware the pair have an ulterior motive involving a fashion shoot and an outrageous designer. Fern Britton and Jean-Paul Gaultier guest star

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In the Welsh mountains of Snowdonia, Michael Portillo reaches an abandoned mine with an art-related history. He also explores the harbour town of Porthmadog, and the fantasy village Portmeirion, crafted by architect Bertram Clough Williams-Ellis, and made famous by The Prisoner TV series

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In the elegant coastal town of Aberystwyth, Michael Portillo visits the National Library of Wales, set high on a hill with views over Cardigan Bay. His tour of North Wales draws to a close in style at the birthplace of the nations first classical music festival, Gregynog Hall, near Newtown

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the trail of an historic achievement made at the dawn of the Edwardian era, Michael Portillo investigates the first radio signal to be sent across the Atlantic. Then, in Plymouth, he uncovers what happened to surviving crew members of the most famous ocean liner in history, the Titanic. Later, at Fowey, the former politician rediscovers a lost literary figure known as Q, who immortalised the town in his novels

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from East Yorkshire to Caernarfon, beginning by travelling from the city of Hull to the North Yorkshire market town of Malton

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his Edwardian Bradshaws guide, Michael Portillo conducts important research in an historic tea room, built by an Edwardian immigrant to the city of York. In Leeds he discovers the citys textile heritage, and also investigates Bradfords musical heritage

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels to the steel city of Sheffield where he discovers an early 20th century steam engine which produced armour plates for a Royal Navy warship. Then, Michael heads south into Nottinghamshire and to the former pit village of Eastwood, before arriving in Nantwich, where he takes a dip in the briny

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Crabbing off the Outer Hebrides is hindered by December gales - the worst weather encountered in four years of the series. Father and son Charlie and Charles McBride owe thousands of pounds for illegally landing fish beyond their quota, with a spell in prison looming if they are not able to settle these debts

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: Documentary charting the contrasting fortunes of British fishing boats over the course of one brutal week. Ocean Pride targets shipwrecks off Cornwall in pursuit of pollack, and Margaret of Ladram hunts for lucrative Dover sole in the English Channel. Meanwhile, off the Yorkshire coast, crabber Tydus welcomes a greenhorn to the crew

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Pauls on a big day out collecting a 1971 Jaguar E-Type and a 1933 Morgan three-wheeler Supersport, but first theres a flock of 300 chickens to negotiate before he can load up

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves in fast car heaven as he picks up a rare Subaru Impreza and an equally powerful Ford Escort RS Cosworth from North Wales

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1968 Honda N600 car emerges from a lock up in County Durham and Dereks in Scotland to collect an original RAC Bedford van

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus Gregory and Will Trickett want to buy a BMW, and Will says he likes the feminine Z3. Theres a trade-in up the road which might fit the bill but its a high price. Can they get the deal they want?

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses fly with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the worlds mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the worlds largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: On the fourth leg of his journey through the continent, Simon travels through three of the worlds most extreme environments as he takes in the salt flats of Bolivia, Brazils Pantanal wetland region and Paraguays Chaco Forest. In Bolivia, he meets a family making a living carving salt from the vast white expanse of the Uyuni flats, while in Brazil he has a close encounter with South Americas apex predator, the jaguar. In Paraguay, Simon visits a Mennonites school, where traditionally clothed children are drilled in Bible texts and there are no smartphones to be seen

programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: The presenter hikes the Great Glen Way in Scotland, a rift valley that cuts through the Highlands from the foot of Ben Nevis to Loch Ness

programme.title: Flipping Bangers

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Liverpool and Wales. Along the way he discovers a childhood favourite - a miniature tank engine with three carriages in dark red - made by Frank Hornby, and learns the story of a Welsh countess who lived in Gwrych Castle. In Snowdonia, he also rides the waves with a Welsh surfing champion

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In picturesque Snowdonia, Michael Portillo braves the fastest zip line in the world - stretching 1,500 feet across a vast slate quarry as he begins the last leg of his journey to Caernarfon. En route, he also visits the home of British mountaineering, Pen y Gwryd, to hear how an Edwardian journalist and poet created a climbing community, which grew to include men who would conquer Everest in the 1950s

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Hassocks and makes his way to the beautiful Sussex village of Ditchling, where a Roman Catholic community of artists once made their home. Next, he visits the seaside town of Bexhill-on-Sea, before the Kent and East Sussex heritage railway conveys Michael from Bodiam Castle through the scenic Rother Valley to Tenterden, and finally arrives in the village of Benenden

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows his 1930s Bradshaws guide to the unspoilt East Sussex port of Rye, where he learns about the loss of a generation of lifeboatmen in 1928. programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts pay a second visit to Hopetoun House in South Queensferry, Edinburgh, valuing items including Victorian dresses worn by royalty, a silver jewel box that dates back to the 16th century and a famous photograph of the Forth Bridge that was used as part of a Nazi propaganda campaign during the Second World War

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

The manner of her death creates a sensation in the tense village community of Little Ambrose, but although the womans husband confesses to the crime, Miss Marple uncovers new evidence that could affect the court hearings outcome and races to halt proceedings before the wrong person is convicted. programme.title: Wild Britain
programme.desc: Revealing the hidden lives of the familiar and the more unusual animals in the United Kingdom, including the golden eagle, red deer and reindeer. Cameras also follow a bold project attempting to re-tree the Scottish uplands and recreate the ancient Caledonian Forest

programme.title: Zoo Days

programme.title: Zoo Days
programme.desc: Tough choices have to be made about Asha the lionesss sick new cubs, and Rafters the giraffe is also seriously ill, with the keepers bracing themselves for his possible death

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Former athlete and strongman Geoff Capes hosts a dinner party for four guests, who will win a cash prize if they can guess his identity from cryptic culinary clues. He provides hints for his diners while serving up dishes in his home. Presented by Brian McFadden

programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream home renovation at little cost. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as two households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. Two families are selected from the same region each week and each has a tired room in need of renovation and re-imagining containing a potential treasure trove of up-cycling gems

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King are in the Norfolk village of East Barsham, hunting for local produce for creative country pub chef Jake, to help him keep the menu fresh for his 40-seat restaurant. Heading off, they find Norfolk geese at a local farm, a company that makes its own version of versatile vegetarian ingredient Tofu and a family-owned plum orchard. But will Jake be impressed by the Bikers suggestions?

programme.title: Pressure Pad

programme.title: Tipping Point

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi climbs aboard floating hotel the African Queen, situated on the Thames, to help owners Bonny and Andy Cowley improve their 30 per cent occupancy. Although she is impressed with the accommodation and quality of food on the 85-year-old Dutch barge, Alex fears Andys approach to hosting is too zealous. She suggests he add extra touches to the bedrooms and spruce up the scruffy exterior, before inviting local businesspeople to a relaunch party

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Former Liberty X star Michelle Heaton hosts a dinner party for four guests who must use a series of clues on offer to ascertain her identity, win a cash prize and avoid having to wash up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Heathrow: Britains Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Storm Eunice wreaks havoc at Heathrow airport, as staff deal with a deluge of delays and unhappy passengers, and also try to deter debris from hitting the runway. Elsewhere, passenger experience manager Harry has to deal with a breach of security that affects hundreds of passengers jetting off on holiday

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A Russian trawlerman found hiding in a local womans shed is accused of being a spy by a Home Office official (The Office star Patrick Baladi) - but Walker and Carol discover the government worker has secrets of his own to hide. Peggy turns detective after an old note found among a dead friends belongings raises questions about her husbands disappearance. With Jonathan Kerrigan and Lisa Kay

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: A Breath of French Air - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The family warms to the French way of life, but Charley is unhappy with Mariettes flirting - and after a little Dutch courage, decides to take matters into his own hands. Drama, starring Philip Franks and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Anyas condition worsens as Bear vows to look after her, while Vinny sees through Lewiss false positivity and Kev gets a surprise

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Adam is quick to question Dr Weatherills competence when a beach outing ends tragically for a family. Dr Ormerod leaps in to defend her - but ends up revealing his colleagues condition in his haste. Meanwhile, Dr Goodwin struggles to help a pair of teenage parents gain access to their baby. Amy Robbins and Robert Daws star

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: Lady Virginia Revel receives a marriage proposal from an ambitious politician, but is reluctant to accept it, especially as she is also being courted by a dashing young suitor. Accompanied by Miss Marple, she travels to a weekend party at her family home Chimneys, hoping to reach a decision. Negotiations for the sale of the country house are taking place during the gathering, but when new owner Count Ludwig of Austria is found murdered, St Mary Meads elderly spinster must identify the culprit. Whodunit, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast including Gavin and Stacey stars Ruth Jones and Mathew Horne, plus Dervla Kirwan, Charlotte Salt, Michelle Collins, Jonas Armstrong and Edward Fox

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Peggy begins a frantic search for Davids dog Deefer after a pair of youths steal her car from outside the Aidensfield Arms with the hound in the boot. Carol and Rob have cause for concern as Rosie is troubled by the attentions of an admirer who simply will not take no for an answer - and also has a history of violence against a former girlfriend. Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor and Vanessa Hehir star

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: As a doctor arrives to make a study of lung diseases at Wheal Leisure, Ross sets about forming an alliance with his fellow mine-owners to build their own smelting company and break Warleggans stranglehold on copper prices. However, Francis is deeply in debt to George - and what money he does have is being spent on lavish gifts for ambitious prostitute Margaret. Demelza resolves to lift Veritys spirits by reconciling her with her lost love Captain Blamey, and theres a new woman in Marks life - but she demands he finds her a home before they are married

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Becky fights back when she finds herself targeted, Carl implicates Debbie in a financial oversight, and Cassie takes Tyrone to his physio appointment when Fiz is called away

programme.desc: Bear is distraught, while Robert is shaken and Nicola warns Kev off

programme.title: Rig 45
programme.desc: A damage regulator is sent to investigate an accident on an oil rig two days before Christmas, but just as the crew realise it was a murder, the rig is cut off from the mainland by a hurricane, while the murderer is still among everyone on board. Drama, starring David Dencik

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: As the summer draws to a close, Cathy and Michael see each other for the first time in months. Meanwhile, Maureen is in hospital and Reg waits anxiously for the news. Subtle family comedy, starring Lesley Manville, Peter Mullan and Lisa McGrillis

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: Its November and Cathy is having a bonfire. As Michael attempts to move on after the death of his mother, Cathy feels she needs to tell him something. Comedy, starring Lesley Manville and Peter Mullan

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the rolling jackpot on offer

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

Plus, American singer-songwriter Sombr performs his current single 12 to 12

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: Johnny and Moira go to an estate sale, Mutt surprises Alexis with a bike, while Roland asks David to help him shop for a special item. Comedy, starring Eugene Levy

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: Johnny talks himself into an unlikely business partnership with Bob. David gets an interview at a womens clothing shop, while Moira reluctantly cares for an ailing Alexis. Sitcom, starring Eugene Levy
